channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for AR

item.title: Report E-2024070024
item.description:
Report E-2024070024

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-05T18:14:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-20
  • City: LITTLE ROCK
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 20, 2024, one (1) 40-gallon drum of paint was damaged by a forklift and released approximately twenty (20) gallons of paint to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted site. LSH personnel overpacked the damaged drum in one (1) 95-gallon drum for disposal. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to collect all impacted material in one (1) additional 95-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024061572
item.description:
Report X-2024061572

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-02T15:12:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-25
  • City: PINE BLUFF
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNION PACIFIC RAILROAD COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 1500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Found by the FRA Hazmat with a leaking secondary closure plug. Upon inspection, the bottom outlet valve was found to be in the fully open position, even though the valve handle was closed and sealed. The valve operating stem had a sheared pin which did not close the valve. A pin was installed, the valve closed, and the plug properly secured. Eight of eight manway swing bolts were also less than tool tight and properly secured.

item.title: Report X-2024061580
item.description:
Report X-2024061580

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-02T15:12:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-25
  • City: PINE BLUFF
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNION PACIFIC RAILROAD
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Found with by the FRA with a strong odor and all the manway swing bolts in the down position. Upon arrival, UP HMM properly secured the bolts and the odor dissipated and no further evidence of a release. All other fittings and devices were properly secured
